entry.title: writing for IELTS(2)
entry.content:
Internet

Life quality

People living in 21st century have a better life quality than the people who lived in the previous centuries. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Mind Mapping

Words or Sentences

First:

It is an undeniable fact that the world has been advancing rapidly since the beginning of this century. Therefore, many people opine that today our living standards are much better than those of our ancestors. l agree with that ,which has manifold reasons to substantiate it.

Second:

Granted, quality of material life is being well-off. //诚然，物质生活质量越来越小康

However, the mental problems cannot be ignored in contemporary.

sleep disorder, depression, and compulsive disorder //睡眠障碍、抑郁症和强迫症的受害者

fast pace of living, heavier strain(沉重的压力） work and study pressure, and financial burden

Third and fourth:

high-speed rail,subway,and shared bikes

This allows people to reach any destination they desire in less time.

intelligent home appliance //智能家电设施

better medical resources, improving contemporary people’s physical health.

For example, COVID-19 vaccine has decreased the rates of death; medicine for cancer can be treated effectively; surgery facility reduce the pain and body damage. Compared to the contemporary people, people in the past were more susceptible to diseases, causing that the fatality rate of infectious was high.

Fifth:

In short, the people who live in the present century are enjoying the benefits of better services in the health, transport and communication sectors. Therefore, I believe, we enjoy a better quality of life than our ancestors.

Others

Urbanization

Many cities replace farmlands and parks with houses. Is it positive or negative?

Mind Mapping

Words or Sentences

First:

Some societies have seen the nature being destroyed by urbanization. However,whether it is a blessing or a curse is a controversial issue. I stand firmly on the side which thinks it is negative. I regard this trend as short-sighted and detrimental.

Second:

extent alleviate the tension of house shortage //缓解住房紧缺

With the sea of people flooding into metropolises for the sake of seeking greater employment possibilities and a higher standard of living, the demand for house supply is increasing at an overwhelming rate. //随着为了寻求更大的就业机会和更高的生活水平而涌入大都市的人群，对住房供应的需求正在以压倒性的速度增长。

Besides, since urbanization is an inevitable and irreversible trend, relocation of farmlands can make the area more fit the overall image of the modernized metropolitan city. //此外，由于城市化是一个不可避免和不可逆转的趋势，农田的搬迁可以使该地区更符合现代化大都市的整体形象。

Third and fourth:

The detriments that this development has must not be overlooked.

As one of the fundamental parts of amenities, parks usually function as the places for residents’ physical exercises and other leisure activities.

considering increasingly erratic weather patterns,political and economic upheavals, and ever more mouths to feed across the planet,prudent planning for the future would prioritize locally-grown food by preserving farmlands rather than destroying it for residential areas.

Fifth:

In conclusion, we can understand why many cities have already transformed the public parks in urban areas and farmlands in the outskirt into living complexes, but these cities will par for such action in the near future.

entry.title: Speaking for IELTS
entry.content:
Person

famous person

Mind

  1. 描述人物：职业、外貌、第一次如何知道他
  2. 人物生平：出名前、出名中（因何而出名）、出名后（现状）
  3. 看法：feeling + eg

Messi

I would like to talk about Lionel Messi, the only player who has won a 7-time Ballon d’Or[1].On the court, where professional players average about 183 in height, Messi looks so small at 170, but no one dares to ignore his role on the court. As for how I first got to know him, I still remember it. That happened in the 2007 season, Barcelona against Real Madrid, where 19 Messi scored his first career hat-trick.

Messi, whom we often know now, is the top player who has won 10 La Liga titles and 4 Champions League titles. But not many people know that when Messi was young, he almost gave up football because of a lack of growth hormone, but thanks to Barca’s timely intervention, which helped Messi pay for high treatment costs, the football player showed talent in the days to come. The fame and money that football brings has not addicted him to live a luxury and dissipation life. He is passionate about philanthropy and the construction of football in his hometown.

There are two reasons why l am interested in him. Firstly,l am obsessed with his superb football skills,which is extremely watchable. Just like what l said before he is born for soccer. Secondly, his humility and unafraid of challenges inspire me. Peach and plum don’t say anything, but they are self-made[2].In the end, I sincerely wish him to win the FIFA World Cup Trophy[3] in this year.

Professor Tang

l would like to talk about Professor Tang Yu. Perhaps he is not well known among the ordinary people of our country, but in our field of expertise he is a highly respected scholar. He is tall and slim, always wearing a pair of black-rimmed glasses, a standard scholarly demeanor. The first time I met him was in my junior year of college, where he taught us a course on big data science and technology.

Like many academics, he also studied abroad at a young age. After receiving his Ph.D. from MIT, he chose to return to China and eventually came to our school to teach. He is fascinated by the front-end technology of big data science , published many papers at home and abroad, and won the first prize of national science and technology.

Although he is a long-established professor, he is humble in class. Since learning about big data for the first time, I often asked him questions. These questions that may seem like idiots to him, but he were patiently answered for me. At the same time, his profound knowledge also deeply influenced me, so that I finally chose the path of big data science, and he was the guide on my learning path.

  1. 金球奖 ↩
  2. 桃李不言，下自成蹊 ↩
  3. 大力神杯 ↩
